alert.note: Alert for Northern Humboldt Coast (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Beach Hazards Statement issued November 25 at 10:18PM PST until November 26 at 7:00PM PST by NWS Eureka
info.description: ...BEACH HAZARDS STATEMENT REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH SUNDAY EVENING... ...COASTAL FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 9 AM TO 11 AM PST SUNDAY... * WHAT...For the Coastal Flood Advisory, High astronomical tides will cause minor flooding in low lying areas around the Humboldt Bay, particularly in King Salmon and Jackson Ranch Road in Arcata Bottoms. For the Beach Hazards Statement, increased threat of sneaker waves expected. * WHERE...Northern Humboldt Coast County. * WHEN...For the Coastal Flood Advisory, from 9 AM to 11 AM PST Sunday. For the Beach Hazards Statement, through Sunday evening.. . * IMPACTS...Flooding of lots, parks, and roads with only isolated road closures expected. Large, unexpected waves can sweep across the beach without warning, sweeping people into the sea from rocks, jetties, and beaches. These sneaker waves can also move large objects such as logs, crushing anyone caught underneath.
info.instruction: A Coastal Flood Advisory indicates that onshore winds and tides will combine to generate flooding of low areas along the shore. Feet Above Ground is locally defined as feet above the Highest Astronomical Tide or HAT. Don`t be fooled by an ocean that looks calm. There can be 30 minutes of small waves before a sneaker wave strikes. Avoid rocks and jetties. Avoid steep beaches. Stay much farther back from the water and never turn your back on the ocean.
